name: Cisco-IP-Phone
author: Brendan Coles <bcoles@gmail.com>
description: This plugin identifies Cisco IP phones and extracts the internal hostname which is also the device's MAC adress prefixed with 'SEP'

matches.regexp:
(?-mix:

[^<]{5,50}<\/FONT><\/B>

Cisco[^\(]{0,15} IP Phone ([^\(]{4,20}) \( [^\)]{15} \)[\s]?<\/FONT><\/FONT><\/B><\/TD>)

(?-mix:

[^<]{5,50}<\/FONT><\/B>

Cisco[^\(]{0,15} IP Phone [^\(]{4,20} \( ([^\)]{15}) \)[\s]?<\/FONT><\/FONT><\/B><\/TD>)

(?-mix:

[^<]{5,50}<\/FONT><\/B>

Cisco Unified IP Phone ([^\(]{4,20}) \( [^\)]{15} \)[\s]?<\/FONT><\/FONT><\/B><\/TD>)

(?-mix:

[^<]{5,50}<\/FONT><\/B>

Cisco Unified IP Phone [^\(]{4,20} \( ([^\)]{15}) \)[\s]?<\/FONT><\/FONT><\/B><\/TD>)
(?-mix:<title>Cisco Unified Wireless IP Phone ([^<]{4,20})<\/title><link href="\/style.css" type=text\/css rel=stylesheet><\/head>)

(?-mix:

Cisco Unified Wireless IP Phone ([^\(]{4,20}) \( [^\)]{15} \)<\/span><\/b><\/p>)

(?-mix:

Cisco Unified Wireless IP Phone [^\(]{4,20} \( ([^\)]{15}) \)<\/span><\/b><\/p>)
